text: <a href="../Song-of-Solomon-2-1/" title="Song of Solomon 2:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 I *am* the rose of Sharon, *and* the lily of the valleys.
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-2-2/" title="Song of Solomon 2:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 As the lily among thorns, so *is* my love among the daughters.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-2-3/" title="Song of Solomon 2:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 As the apple tree among the trees of the wood, so *is* my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight, and his fruit *was* sweet to my taste.
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-2-4/" title="Song of Solomon 2:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 He brought me to the banqueting house, and his banner over me *was* love.
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-2-5/" title="Song of Solomon 2:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 Stay me with flagons, comfort me with apples: for I *am* sick of love.
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-2-6/" title="Song of Solomon 2:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 His left hand *is* under my head, and his right hand doth embrace me.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-2-7/" title="Song of Solomon 2:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that ye stir not up, nor awake *my* love, till he please.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-2-8/" title="Song of Solomon 2:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 The voice of my beloved! behold, he cometh leaping upon the mountains, skipping upon the hills.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-2-9/" title="Song of Solomon 2:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 My beloved is like a roe or a young hart: behold, he standeth behind our wall, he looketh forth at the windows, shewing himself through the lattice.
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-2-10/" title="Song of Solomon 2:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 My beloved spake, and said unto me, Rise up, my love, my fair one, and come away.
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-2-11/" title="Song of Solomon 2:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 For, lo, the winter is past, the rain is over *and* gone;

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-2-12/" title="Song of Solomon 2:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 The flowers appear on the earth; the time of the singing *of birds* is come, and the voice of the turtle is heard in our land;

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-2-13/" title="Song of Solomon 2:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 The fig tree putteth forth her green figs, and the vines *with* the tender grape give a *good* smell. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-2-14/" title="Song of Solomon 2:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 O my dove, *that art* in the clefts of the rock, in the secret *places* of the stairs, let me see thy countenance, let me hear thy voice; for sweet *is* thy voice, and thy countenance *is* comely.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-2-15/" title="Song of Solomon 2:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 Take us the foxes, the little foxes, that spoil the vines: for our vines *have* tender grapes.
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-2-16/" title="Song of Solomon 2:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 My beloved *is* mine, and I *am* his: he feedeth among the lilies.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-2-17/" title="Song of Solomon 2:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, turn, my beloved, and be thou like a roe or a young hart upon the mountains of Bether.
